newsitem.title: UK: UK's Major says blasts "two-fingered insult".
newsitem.headline: UK's Major says blasts "two-fingered insult".

text.p: British Prime Minister John Major said on Wednesday it looked "very much as though" two blasts in northwestern England were the work of the IRA.

"It looks very much as though it was a two-fingered insult to democracy at the start of a general election campaign in which Sinn Fein are fielding candidates right across Northern Ireland," he told reporters. Sinn Fein is the political wing of the banned Irish Republican Army (IRA).

"I hope very much that IRA/Sinn Fein are not going to conduct their campaigns at the ballot box in Northern Ireland and with bombs on the mainland of Britain," Major said before leaving London's Heathrow Airport for a campaign trip.

Two bombs damaged railway tracks and signalling equipment at the northwestern English town of Wilmslow early on Wednesday after a coded warning from the Irish Republican Army, BBC radio said. Britain has an election on May 1.
"I think it's impossible to judge the minds of people who plant bombs indiscriminately and I find it very diffuclt to understand their mentality," Major said.
"Whether they're doing this because they think that in some warped perverted way that this will show their supporters that the IRA are still there as a real force -- I don't know."
